page.title: 05A TYPICAL LOCAL FARM
page.content:
drystone walls remain, in a few places patched with wire.
Mr Hirst has been running his farm for 33 years. He was farming before at Scholes, Holmfirth. He was brought up on a farm. He says that the area has changed a lot because of better farm machinery and more modern farming methods. His farm consists of 175 acres, 2 of these are arable, and 173 are grass land. 80 acres of this he mows for hay and silage; 93 acres are used for grazing pastures. His land is scattered {NOT}in one block. He has 80 Fresians, used for milking and some charolais for beef. He has sixteen breeding cows and 32 calves. He also has 50 breeding ewes, from which he has raised 92 lambs this year. He buys and sells at Penistone and Huddersfield markets. Penistone market
